title: Installing RStudio
text:
Rstudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R, providing a user-friendly interface for R programming.






Note



RStudio is moving away from its R-exclusive focus and becoming Posit in October 2022 to enable broader data science, scientific research, and technical communication functionalities and, in particular, to integrate Python users.








Important



In order for RStudio desktop to work with R you must have installed R on your computer, see Section A.1. RStudio does not include R when you download and install it.



Step 1Step 2Step 3Step 4Step 5Step 6


DOWNLOAD RStudio
You can download R from the RStudio website. There are different RStudio products available, but the free Desktop version offers all necessary features for your analyses.



CHOOSE YOUR OPERATION SYSTEM
Download the RStudio Desktop installer compatible with your operating system.



RUN THE INSTALLER
Locate the downloaded file in your computer’s Downloads folder and double-click to run the setup.



COMPLETE INSTALLATION
Follow the instruction in the installation wizard to complete the installation process.



CONFIGURATION
After installing RStudio, open the application. Navigate to Tools > Global options to set your preferences.



Under the General options and the Basic tab:
Workspace
Uncheck Restore .RData into workspace at startup
Ensure that Never is selected for Save workspace to .RData on exit.
History
Uncheck Always save history (even when not saving .RData)
Uncheck Remove duplicate entries in history

Uncheck Remove duplicate entries in history

title: Installing R
text: R is a powerful programming language for statistical computing and graphics. It is one of main programming language used for data science (with other programming languages such as Python and Julia). The following instructions will show you how to install R on either a Windows or a Mac computer.

title: Installing R
text:
Installing R on Windows

Step 1Step 2Step 3Step 4Step 5Step 6


DOWNLOAD R
Visit the Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) to download R which is a network of servers around the world that store identical up-to-date versions of code and documentation for R. 
 Scroll down the page to locate the mirror that is the closest to your geographic location and click on its URL.






Tip



Selecting a mirror that is close to you may help speed up the download. You can still use another mirror since the closest geographic location does not always give the best mirror.


For instance, when downloading R from Rwanda, you can select the mirror from South Africa.


CHOOSE YOUR OPERATION SYSTEM
Once on the CRAN page, select your operating system: Linux, macOS, or Windows. 



Select binaries for base distribution




DOWNLOAD THE INSTALLER
Download the R installer (< 80 MB)




RUN THE INSTALLER
Locate the downloaded file in your computer’s Downloads folder and double-click to run the installation wizard.




COMPLETE INSTALLATION
Follow the instruction in the installation wizard to complete the installation.

title: Before You Arrive: Install R and RStudio
text:
We’re so excited to have you join us in Kigali for AMMNet 2024! If you are registered to attend one of the training sessions listed below, you are required to have R and RStudio downloaded and installed on your laptops before you arrive at the training. Because this software can take some time to download and we cannot guarantee the strength of conference WiFi, we strongly recommend that you complete the installation before arriving at the conference. Detailed instructions on installing R, RStudio, and any required packages can be found below.
If you run into any difficulties, please reach out to info@ammnet.org for assistance. There will also be a technical helpdesk avaliable at the conference, but again, we will not be able to guarantee download speeds at that time.






Trainings with R and RStudio Requirements



Building Web Interfaces for Effective Model Communication, Exploration and Debugging
Principles and Practice of Data Visualization with R


The materials on this page were developed and shared with permission by Gloria Shirima and Amelia Bertozzi-Villa.

title: Before You Arrive: Install R and RStudio
text:
On Windows

Step 1Step 2Step 3Step 4Step 5Step 6


Download R
Visit the Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) to download R which is a network of servers around the world that store identical up-to-date versions of code and documentation for R. 
 Scroll down the page to locate the mirror that is the closest to your geographic location and click on its URL.






Tip



Selecting a mirror that is close to you may help speed up the download. You can still use another mirror since the closest geographic location does not always give the best mirror.


For instance, when downloading R from Rwanda, you can select the mirror from South Africa.


Choose Your Operating System
Once on the CRAN page, select the operating system Windows. 



Select binaries for base distribution




Download the Installer
Download the R installer (< 80 MB)




Run the Installer
Locate the downloaded file in your computer’s Downloads folder and double-click to run the installation wizard.




Complete Installation
Follow the instruction in the installation wizard to complete the installation.

title: Before You Arrive: Install R and RStudio
text:
On MacOS

Step 1Step 2Step 3Step 4Step 5


Download R
Visit the Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) to download R which is a network of servers around the world that store identical up-to-date versions of code and documentation for R. 
 Scroll down the page to locate the mirror that is the closest to your geographic location and click on its URL.






Tip



Selecting a mirror that is close to you may help speed up the download. You can still use another mirror since the closest geographic location does not always give the best mirror.


For instance, when downloading R from Rwanda, you can select the mirror from South Africa.


Choose Your Operating System
Once on the CRAN page, select the operating system macOS. 



You will be directed to a page that looks like this:


You must now select one of two binary packages to install, depending on the age of your computer. Go to the Apple icon in the top left corner of your Mac and select “About This Mac”.


When you click, a small window will appear giving you information about your computer. Notice what is written next to the “Chip:” label:

 
If the chip is M1, M2, or M3, click the arm64.pkg installer on the R installation page. If the chip does not say M1, M2, or M3, clicke the x86_64.pkg installer.


Download the Installer
Download the R installer (~100 MB). When it has installed, click on it in your “Downloads” folder.




Run the Installer
Locate the downloaded file in your computer’s Downloads folder and double-click to run the installation wizard. When the installation is complete, you may be prompted to delete the installer file. If you are prompted, press “Yes”. If you are not prompted, you can delete the installer .pkg file manually.

title: Before You Arrive: Install R and RStudio
text:
Using the Graphic Interface

Step 1Step 2Step 3


Open RStudio on your computer.


In RStudio, you can install a new package by selecting Tools > Install packages… 


Enter the name of the package you want to install, or browse through available packages. Select the desired package(s) and click Install to add them to your R environment.

title: Before You Arrive: Install R and RStudio
text:
Using the RStudio Console

Step 1Step 2Step 3Step 4


Open RStudio on your computer.


In the “Console” tab (at the bottom left of the screen if using the default settings), type install.packages("PACKAGE_NAME"), with the name of the package instead of the letters “PACKAGE_NAME”. Don’t forget the quotation marks! For example, to install the tidyverse package, type install.packages("tidyverse"):



You should see a series of text scrolling down the screen (there might be a lot!), followed by a message saying that “the downloaded binary packages are in [location]”.






Tip



There should not be any error messages in this process! If you run into errors, try installing via the user interface. If there are still problems, contact the AMMnet team for support.





Test the successful installation by “loading” the package into the console.
Type the words find.package("PACKAGE_NAME") into the console. If the package installed successfully, you should see a filepath to the location of the package. If the package didn’t install successfully, you’ll see an error message. Below, you can see an example with a successfully installed package (tidyverse) and a package that has not been installed (fake_package).






Tip



If you run into errors, try installing via the user interface. If there are still problems, contact the AMMnet team for support.

title: Installing R Packages
text:
Note



A R package is a collection of functions, data, and compiled code in a well-defined format, created to add specific functionality to R.
There are 10,000+ user contributed packages and growing.
There is a set of standard (or base) packages which is considered part of the R source code and automatically available as part of your R installation. Base packages contain the basic functions that allow R to work, and enable standard statistical and graphical functions on data sets.



Step 1Step 2Step 3


Open RStudio on your computer


In RStudio, you can install a new package by selecting Tools > Install packages… 


Enter the name of the package you want to install, or browse through available packages. Select the desired package(s) and click Install to add them to your R environment.

title: Training Information
text:
The goal of this workshop is to equip participants with the ability to recognize and produce data visualizations in accordance with the best practices of the field. Looking forward to meeting you all!


The workshop takes place at .. Hotel. The conference room is … Hall.



Please try to have these installed before the training, if you have any trouble installing we will have a station on 18th April where you can come for assistance (The steps migt take approximately 15 minutes).
a.  [Install R]( )

b.  [Install and setup RStudio Desktop]( )

c.  [libraries]( )






note




All software used in this workshop are free.
If you have any difficulties with the installation, support can be provided on the first day of the AMMnet meeting or before the session or during breaks.












Table 1: Overview Schedule







Time
Session





15min before
Welcome
Support for software installation



15min
Introduction to data Visualization presentation



30min
Introduction to R Studio, Reading Data, GGplot



30min
coffee Break



50min
Line Plot, Scatter Plots and Exercise



30min
combination of line and Scatter & Exercise



20min
Winding up session & survey filling










Fill out the online post-workshop questionnaire (link to be provided after the workshop)
